name: J R
text: Took my truck here in Oct of 2020 and they forgot to reconnect the sway bar up front, which I fixed. Then gave them a second chance with my wife's car and just discovered they only replaced 3 of the 5 lug bolts on one wheel. Now I have to buy new lug bolts. Go somewhere else if you want the job done correctly.

resp.text: Our apologies that we did not meet your expectations, not what we want to have happen! I see that we have already opened a customer service ticket, we will be back in touch soon!

name: Amanda
text:
As a woman I can say that I have never had a good experience in places when getting my car serviced.  I am spoken down to, given hidden charges, and just treated with general disrespect.
But this was absolutely not the case coming here. Ricky was incredibly nice and spoke to me like an actual human being. I told him what I needed and what time I needed it done. Not only was it done in the exact time I needed, he called to verify what we discussed and verify the price. He did not try to sell my anything unnecessary. And the price wasn't a penny over what he told me. It was an amazing experience and it will be the only place I get my car serviced for the foreseeable future. Thank you for your respect and impeccable service.

resp.text: Thanks for the stars, Amanda! Glad the team was able to take such great care of you. Take care!

name: Kevin Stephens
text: This review is more for an employee than the store itself. Not to take away from the store, though, the store is great. Tire Tech, Ricky, deserves a large amount of praise. That gentleman works his behind off. Every time I’m in the store, he’s there. Working hard. He’s got a fantastic attitude and a general willingness to help. If someone from Tire Discounters sees this, give that man a raise.

resp.text: Awww, thank you for the 5-star review and the kind comments Ricky. We are so glad you had a great experience Kevin, we do what we do for customers just like you. Please come back and see us again when you need us and stay safe out there!

name: Claire Tomlin
text:
Fantastic service! They helped me with my tire issue and Ima go back to them for all my tire needs!

Pros: Honest and down to earth; easy to talk to!

Cons: a bit standoffish at first but it may have been the weather (Torrential downpour)

resp.text: That’s how we rock so you can roll Claire! Thank you for the feedback and 5-star review! We work hard to provide you with a great experience. Please come back to see us again when you need us. Stay safe out there!

name: William Swinson
text: Joseph the manager and his staff have been phenomenal. Great prices and the service is simply outstanding. He and his team helped me solve a major problem that 2020+ Ram 1500 have major complaints about due to tire shimmy at certain speeds. They fixed the entire problem by performing a “dynamic balancing” splitting the needed weights and road force validation. So these folks saved me from a problem that most folks can’t figure out. Truck runs smooth as silk now and these guys were a pleasure to work with. I will NEVER NEVER take my vehicles anywhere else. You guys just made me a customer for life. Just so you know, I make a living teaching organizations how to be efficient and “customer-centric” and these guys rock !!!! Thanks guys!!!!! Ed

resp.text: That’s how we roll, William! Glad we were able to take such good care of you. Thanks, and we’ll see you again down the road!

name: Ryan Cass
text: For the last 5 years I’ve been taking my Camry to NTB in Huntsville and they were fine until they started trying to up sell me on stuff I didn’t need and their prices kept going up with the staff becoming less and less friendly too. When Tire Discounters opened up on Winchester road I looked forward to trying them out since they are much closer and after having some work done on my other vehicles I knew this would be the right place to get a fresh set of tires. They had a great sale going on for Pirelli’s and they are driving great, hopefully they maintain their friendly service and good prices because this is where I’ll be going for the life of my new tires.

resp.text: We rock so you can roll! We're the authority in customer service and auto safety, Ryan. See ya in 5000 miles for your 1st of many free lifetime tire care visits. We want to take make sure we take good care of those new puppies.

The woman said we should have made appt anyway.  Well we did... we told her when we walked through the door. So she looked and got pretty nervous.  They got us in ASAP ands we finally got the tire fixed.  Overall we will use our tire discounters on W72 and county line. We were out of town and Hampton Cove was thre closest. Good luck if you use them.

resp.text: Terry, our apologies that we did not meet your expectations, not what we want to have happen! We definitely care about your experience and we'd like to connect to learn more. If you would like to discuss, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com so we can get back in touch with you. Please include a copy of your review for reference, we hope to hear back from you soon! Thank you and stay safe!

text: Awesome service! The staff is very  quick, attentive and professional. They patched my SUV for FREE and cleaned the wheels. We were just about to head out for a road trip so this was great. I'll definitely be coming back when those tires need to be replaced.

resp.text: Rockin' and rollin'! Glad we could keep ya rollin' safely, Dan. Hope you enjoyed your trip and we'll see ya again when ya need us.

name: Stefanie Terrell
text: Do not take your vehicle here unless you’d like something coincidentally to happen requiring an additional repair. My husband took his vehicle here for a tire patch which resulted in him being told he needed new tires due to uneven wear. He received a quote and agreed to pursue the new tire service. During service, he was told that his alignment was extremely off; although he had taken his vehicle to the dealership for routine maintenance. They drove his vehicle to our house (courtesy drop-off) and didn’t even mention that the vehicle was making a grinding noise when accelerating and slowing down (4WD issue). Deceitful and dishonest. Their management told my husband that this was a coincidence and a known issue with the make and model of his vehicle. Then proceeded to give him a quote to repair. BUYER BEWARE

resp.text: We have strict policies in place to never oversell unnecessary items and follow MAP guidelines when making any product or service recommendations. We would like to connect you with a TD Rep to learn more and address your concerns, Stefanie. Would you mind sending your preferred contact information to tirediscounters.com/contact? We look forward to connecting.

text: I have been in the body shop repair business for over 30 years so I consider myself to have a better eye for quality than most people.The reason I picked this shop to do my repairs was because of Joel Allen he and did some PDR repair for me and the quality of the repair was second to none!! My review starts off with my estimate with my estimate. Gary Wrote an outstanding estimate! With Gary you not only get someone that is very knowledgeable on cars but you get someone that can actually do the repairs that he writes that is very rare! Now the Repair.They actually finish the repair sooner then they had previously estimated I was amazed most shops are always behind on their estimated time of completion. The quality of the repair was better than I expected!! they did stuff beyond what was written on the estimate and the quality was even better than I expected from Joel. Me being a painter myself I can recognize a quality paint job and I will have to say Jason put one of the best paint jobs that I have seen in the state of Alabama he is truly One of the best painters in the state!!

name: Darrell Lindsey
text:
I have a 2012 Mercedes S550 and my Air Suspension Strut went out. I called World Class and had it towed in. They called me the next day, told me what was going on and gave me a quote. I promise you, they didn’t try to jack me up and tell me that other things were wrong, they just zeroed in on the problem and fixed it. I said that because I think all of us are looking for straight shooters who are not trying to get over on you... Now, because of high demand of car maintenance and everyone wanting their vehicle to be repaired, I had to wait a few days on my car; but it was explained to me upfront. And because of the excellent service and “Great Price,” it was worth the wait and I will be returning again for all of my future repairs!!! I highly recommend World Class because truly they are “World Class!!”
P.S. Brenden is a super nice guy with great customer service and has a “First Class Business!!!

name: Dwayne Carmichael
text: Do not take your vehicle to this place. I brought my BMW X5 there to have the water pump replaced. They replaced the water pump, but damaged other parts on my vehicle while doing the repair. I was quoted $360 labor to replace the water pump. I called to check on my vehicle later that evening, and Yvonne said that her technician was having a hard time installing the water pump and that they had to charge me an extra hour worth of labor. Who fault is that? I told them no way, so they only charged me the $360 that I was originally quoted. However they did mentioned that my car needed 2 more repairs and quoted me $563 for one and $440 for the other. The $440 repair was for a hose that was damaged while they were changing the pump. The hose cost $40 from the BMW dealership and they said it would be 4 hours of labor, which didn't sound right for a hose. I called 3 other independent shops and was quoted $130 for the same repair parts and labor. The $563 was for a hood latch and cable, the parts at dealer are $80. Yvonne also said it would be 4 hours labor. I called several independent shops and was quoted $200 for parts and labor. I guess 4 is there magic number. When I asked Yvonne to double check those quotes all of a sudden she wasn't able to find the labor rates in the system. How did she come up with those figures initially? Bottom line do not take your car to these ppl. Yvonne charges you whatever she feels like and that's not right.

resp.text: We remember you well.  You brought your car late one afternoon with a coolant leak,  and we drove you across town to take you home. You didn't mention that your hood latch was locked and would not open. We spent quite a while to opened the hood to replace the water pump that you brought for us to install, and you declined the hood repair knowing that it would not reopen once it was shut.  We actually charged less labor to install the water pump than the labor guide prescribes.  We also told you about another coolant leak that you say we caused, but we did not; you also declined that repair.  Yes, we would normally charge more because of the extra work to open your hood because of the latch and cable.  Your car came in with several problems, but none caused by us.  We did our best to accommodate you in every way and we're sorry you left dissatisfied.

name: Rico Suave
text: Dropped my car off for a radiator change. It took about a week to just get an estimate when I was told it would be looked at the following morning. When I finally got the estimate, it was on the high end, quoted a few more hours than normal. Continuously called to try to get information over the next week! Was lied to several times throughout the two weeks and one day for a radiator change! Wasn't even notified when they required another part.  On top of it, the manager/owner referred to me as a "damn Yankee". Great business savvy you moron. If you want over priced work, dishonesty, ignorant management this is the place for you. Honestly, the worst experience I've ever had at a car maintenance facility.

text: It has been great having a place you can depend on to service our vehicles. The staff is friendly and the service is the best

name: Cheryl Phillips
text: Went in for tires however I had a brake light and headlight out on the driver side and had asked if they could fix it. I was told to come back that Saturday; May 2nd so that a mechanic can look at it. I went that Saturday and had the lights repaired. That same Saturday night my entire driver side taillight went out. I knew they were closed Sunday but I called just in case I could leave a voicemail to give them a heads up about me coming in on Monday; May 4th regarding the taillight. May 4th they tried to repair the issue however ALL of my lights started malfunctioning. They tell me to come back that Wednesday; May 6th so that their mechanic can look at it. They gave me a work order stating that they are working on diagnosing the problem in case I got pulled over for no brake lights, reverse lights, headlights or turn signal. They proceeded to pull my vehicle through the shop and when I got inside it I noticed an airbag sensor that was not there before. I asked John if he could have it cleared out and he said that he would have the mechanic do it on Wednesday and that it should be no problem. I then attempted to turn my AC on (which was on while they were working on it but John said that he had turned it off) but the AC wouldn't come on. I get out of my vehicle and ask John if he could have the code cleared because I felt that it was messing with the operation of my AC and it's been 90° lately. John then tells another employee named Skyler to come clear the code however the code does not clear. During this time the owner comes and introduces himself and asked me and another customer if we were being tended to, the other customer stated that he was already tended to then I stated that I was being tended to and pointed to my vehicle. The owner then leaves to never return again. They then proceeded to turn the vehicle off in hopes of resetting it however at that point the vehicle would no longer start. John then told me that I needed to leave and that I could return Wednesday to have their mechanic look at it but at this point, I had no dash lights, interior lights, exterior lights, no AC, no radio, no power steering, and sensors going off. The vehicle would no longer start up. I started to get upset, John claims I brought my vehicle in like that which is 100% untrue, I drove it in with no issues other than the driver taillight but I was unable to drive it away. I defended myself and vehicle over that statement then John pulled their doors closed while several employees including a manager/ assistant manager watched. I ended up having to call the police (because I had no clue what else I could or should do). The shop then claimed that I had a bad battery and that was the result of all of this however when they put a brand new battery in there it did NOT fix all the problems, the vehicle did start up and it did have headlights but that was it. After me refusing to tow my vehicle away and almost 2 hours later Mitch (I believe the manager or assistant manager) then offered to let the vehicle stay and have their mechanic look at it on Wednesday May 6th. May 6th, I went to go pick up my vehicle and John was working the front desk, they tried to hand me my keys in the lot hoping I would just leave immediately but when I asked for a full detail work order on what all had been done to my vehicle, I received attitude and was told that I should be happy that they fixed it for free and that they don't document all the work that's done on vehicles. I sat up there until I received a work order (over 30mins later) but when I received the "work order" it stated, "gave customer a battery and replaced 10 fuse". I told the mechanic that that was not a detailed work order but I was told that was all I was going to get. I do not believe that they would have fixed the damages their employee, John, caused to my vehicle if I did not have 4years of documentation from the one and only other mechanic I've been to, video footage from my own vehicle and computer readings from my Vivint smart security proving the condition of my vehicle.

name: Scott Staton
text: Fantastic service!  Lower prices than what I've been paying for oil changes and tire rotation. They even vacuumed! I will continue to use them.

name: John Carasiti
text: Awesome service.

name: Katrina Keith
text: Love these guys 👦 they are wonderful

text: Great place, never had a problem with anything

name: Chad Smith
text: I have an older vehicle and as such I need repairs done more often here lately it seems. David, Michael, and the others here are so personable helpful. I never feel like they are trying to pull one over on me. If they notice something they let me know.  Good job on hiring a quality staff here Mr Duncan.

name: Amy Headrick
text: Super over the top service. They go way out of their way to help you and work with you.

name: John Ogden
text: Great bunch of guys, good prices0

name: Paul Young
text: The shop has been attempting to repair the AC in my van for TWO weeks. I have taken it back to them several times. They have had the van for over a solid week now. Everyday they say it will be ready the next day. The next day they say we need ANOTHER part and it will be tomorrow. I use the van for my business. Not only has this been inconvenient, it has cost me a significant amount of money in lost revenue.  Anyone want to guess what they might tell me tomorrow???

name: Chelsea Jordan
text: Decent prices. Unable to do some extensive work but are great with oil changes and routine maintenance.

name: Chris Gilmore
text: Fantastic service. They go out of their way for the customers. I highly recommend this place. I won't take my vehicles anywhere else.

name: mircea cartas
text: Very nice and professional, strongly recommend!

name: jimmy harris

name: Dale Lamberth
text: They dont deserve to be in business I now own a car they looked at and lied to the owner of it is in horrible condition but no excuse to lie bent pushrods etc.

text: Had a flat tire this morning. Called the shop and they told me to bring it on. A GREAT/WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE. THANKS DON DUNCAN AUTOMOTIVE

text: I needed a tire swapped out for my lawn mower. They were fast, professional and courteous.

name: Bethany Cryder
text:
Every year for the last 5-6 years their customer service has become worse.  One day when I needed to schedule a battery replacement I tried all morning to get to a live person in the service department.  Left a voicemail after lunch (also letting them know this) and told them if they couldn't call me back by EOB they lost me completely.  (This is not their first fumble.)
Obviously they lost a customer.  I had bought cars there, gotten service there for a long while. I simply wanted to /schedule/  an appointment in the next few days. Ah well.

name: Sheree Ford
text:
Their service department really helped me with those Cabin Filters. Changed 1st time in 2 years....
LOVE BRANNON HONDA. BOUGHT MY FAVORITE VEHICLE OF ALL TIMES THERE. 2019 HONDA CRV.
GREAT CAR.... SEE CHARLIE RILEY for all your New Car Needs....

name: Danni Freeman
text: Bought my 2019 CRV here.  Come here for routine maintenance. So far I'm pleased with the service I receive. They have never taken more than about an hour. They are very friendly and so far have not tried to get me to pay for unnecessary services like I've experienced at many other places in the past. The waiting room and restrooms are clean and they have snacks!

name: Ricky Harmon
text: This is the best service I've ever received at a dealership. They've never once beaten me up over "extra" repairs. They always take care of me and are honest and accommodating. I'll pass closer Honda dealerships to go to Brannon. I'll keep going back to them for service and any future vehicle needs.

name: Barb Wils
text: Polite, comfortable, and competent. They know what they are doing!

name: Bubba Fitzhugh
text: For the Honda dealerships around, I think that this one is better all around. Service department is good, friendly, and gets things done quickly. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: shane poteate
text: Much better than "Cats"  I'd shop here again and again

name: Eva Ruffin
text: No one should wait four hours for a seatbelt replacement, especially with an appointment.

name: Sherry Wellington
text: Had service which consisted of an oil change, front end alignment and the air filter. All was well, excellent customer service however,  my skid plate wasnt put back on  (advised of the issue AFTER going to Firestone) and I had to go back. They sent a mechanic to try and provide a solution to the problem and he had no clue what it was. I went to Firestone and merely explained what I was hearing and thats when I was advised it was the skid plate. My question is if a Honda certified mechanic heard the issue and didnt know what it was and I again, only told the gentleman at Firestone, not sure I want them servicing my car.

name: Kady Thompson
text: Took my pilot last week to get an issue fixed. The issue started happening again after we picked it up, called and they advised us to bring it back in so we did. Got a call after we dropped it back off,telling us that Honda told them we have to drive it for 5k miles before they will even try to fix the problem again . Very unhappy. It takes us over an hour to get our car to the dealership and wish they would have told us that before they advised us to drive it back over there all for nothing . I still have an issue with my car and will have wasted 2 hours out of my day . We will not be using them again .

name: M. Price
text: Always do a great job!

name: Joanna Carson
text: I was charged $123 for a diagnosis that I already received from Serra Nissan for free.

name: David King
text: Professional n courteous

name: Andreanna Davis
text: They are absolutely wonderful! I took in my Dad’s 1993 Ford Lightning. We had been having trouble with it going dead and just not running right. Several other local mechanics had tried to fix it with little success. I read about Hesco and decided to give them a try. I’m so glad I did. They got Dad’s truck running perfectly! I will never let anyone else work on it again. They do a great job and great work! I just can’t thank them enough for all they did. Would recommend them highly to anyone.

name: Rick Clark
text: I bought a lotus and it was delivered with a flat tire.  Jeff came out to my house picked up the tire and brought it back the next day to put the tire on and check the pressure in the rest of the tires. He was happy to answer any question I had!  Amazing customer service!  A+!  I will be using them for the service of my car.

name: jeffrey vaughn
text: I grew up next door to Jeff. I remember a day when I looked out and saw a 2nd gen camaro with a blower sitting a foot out of the hood. It was Jeff. I was a kid and did the burnout hand signal..to which he happily obliged. Worked with his lil sis many years later and he still remembered. Genuinely thoughtful and kind dude who exudes knowledge.

name: Bailey Ike
text: The customer service is outstanding, the people working there feel authentic and give the impression they truly care.

name: Radioman
text:
Jeff @ HESCO is unparalleled in his infinite wisdom behind the wheel and under the hood of a car. He has been known to pull a rabbit out of a hat on many occasions. I would not hesitate to take any of my vehicles to him for any reason.
Thanks, Jeff-
Tim @ Rickwood Radio Service

name: Eric Morin
text: At last found a shop to work on my Mazda RX-8 R3 with a twin rotary. Honest diagnosis and job well done. Think it runs better than when I bought it! Thank you Jeff and crew!

resp.text: Thank you for the outstanding feedback, Eric! We are so glad that you were able to find a shop that fit your auto needs, we look forward to working with you and your RX-8 again!

name: Charles B Ireland
text: I have been taking my machine work to Hesco for many years. Best machine shop anywhere. Now that I no longer work on my own vehicles, I intend to entrust them with their care.

resp.text: Charles, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. It is a pleasure to work see you in our machine shop. We are so glad we have gained your long term trust! Let us know if there is anything we can assist you with!

name: Nichole Posten
text: As someone indicated, they do a lot of specialty high end vehicle work but it has been well worth the extra to know that the work is done right.  I have been taking my now 10yr old (beater) Jeep here for 8+ years and will take my new Subaru here.  Joe is great and always has the time to spend explaining anything to you.  He even took my husband and son around the shops to look at all of the cars there.

resp.text: Thank you for your loyalty over the years Nichole, we truly appreciate it!

name: Stephen Wilson
text: These guys do some of the best work in Birmingham. That being said, when you see the Ferraris and classic cars in the parking lot you know you are going to pay a price that matches their level of quality work. Don't let the abrasive or lack of communication keep you from at least getting a written quote from their shop. On a side note, get someone to show you around their facility because it is basically an ever changing museum of mechanical genius. Custom builds, daily drivers, etc it's a pretty cool spot in the heart of downtown. If all else fails, you can walk to Good People Brewery or Regions Park  and drink away your sorrows.

resp.text: Thank you for the good review, Stephen! We appreciate getting your feedback and we hope next time we can deliver a 5-star experience!

name: Lindsay Hobbs
text:
I have nothing but good things to say about Hesco and the people working there! My husband and I were driving from Utah to Atlanta when our car broke down in Birmingham. Even though they were busy, they fit us in and got us back on the road the next day! Not only did they fix our car, but they went above and beyond to make sure that we were taken care of while we were stuck in the city. They even called us a few days later to make sure we had made it to our destination safely and without any problems!
We are SO grateful for Jeff, Joe, and everyone else who took such good care of us! This was by far the best experience we have ever had with a mechanic, and would recommend them to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent review, Lindsay! We are glad you arrived safely, and we can't thank you enough for all the kind words. Our goal is to provide our customers with an unbeatable experience every time!

name: Prentice Jones
text: One of my best friends works at this shop so I know they are an A+ shop because Warren is a very good tech.

resp.text: Thank you for the awesome review! We are so glad to have Warren on our team! We appreciate the great recommendation!

name: Jacob Hobbs
text: These are the kind of guys that would take their shirts off their backs to help you. Highly recommend to anyone who appreciates honest and high quality work!

resp.text: We appreciate the great review, Jacob. That is exactly who we strive to be. Thank you for your business, and we hope to see you again!

name: James Gavin
text: On a recent trip from Birmingham back to Atlanta my 2012 Hyundai Equus ran hot about 30 miles outside of Birmingham, we got off at exit 147 wound up having to get it towed back to Birmingham. I didn't know a mechanic in B'ham so I had it delivered to J.B. a Buick dealership, they inspected it for $309 and said that I at the least had a blown head gasket caused by a bad water pump and that it was going to cost me $2215  for them to break down the engine and make sure that there was no further damage with the engine,  and that it could be as much as $4500 to replace all the gaskets through out the engine. NOT TODAY!!! So I did a Google search and came across HESCO, the reviews were great, I spoke with Joe Molina and he arranged to have it tower to HESCO "DESPITE being in the middle of changing locations", they got it in checked it out, started it up, "No white smoke from the tail pipe", turned out to be the water pump, THAT's ALL. I can't recommend Joe Molina and the guys at HESCO Automotive highly enough, they are highly professional, extremely efficient, keep you informed at every juncture of the process, and very reasonable. I am telling ALL my friends and family to take their vehicles to HESCO Automotive. Thanks guys, this was a very stressful situation as I was having to take care of it from Atlanta, Joe you could not have been better.

resp.text: Thank you James! It is great to hear from you and glad we could help you out.  We want to make sure all of our costumes are taken care of and are aware of the repairs needed for their vehicle. We are glad you found us and we could located the problem to your water pump. We truly appreciate your recommendation. Give us a call if you have questions or need anything in the future!

name: Ron Denney
text: I had a bolt sheared off inside my BMW motorcycle wheel. I called Wesco from Hoover and explained the situation and that I lived 90 miles south in Dadeville, AL. I spoke with Joe on the phone. He said bring it in and they would see what they could do for me. They used an easy out to remove the bolt for me quickly and wouldn't even take any money for this service. Great people at WESCO!

resp.text: We really appreciate the excellent review, Ron. We are happy to help. Let us know if there is anything else we can help you with!

name: Ray Clark
text: I have a Z-3 and a 535i and would not let anyone else touch them in Birmingham.  I used to go to Tom Williams for items under warranty and they always found something to fix that did not need fixing.  Anything Joe, Jeff and his folks say, I trust completely.

resp.text: Ray - We cannot thank you enough for your business and the great review! We appreciate being able to work with you.

name: Dawn Brook
text: I took my wife's 07 Murano in for a few repairs and got the same great service as all the exotics Hesco works on. Great guys and service.

resp.text: Roy - Thank you for the great review! It is always a pleasure to be able to work with you and we cannot thank you enough for your business.

name: Katie munkus
text: I was very disappointed with this business. I had to have my car towed here the Wednesday before Thanksgiving. I was told that I would get a detailed estimate the following Monday. I was fine with that. When I called Monday I was told that they had already started replacing and fixing the damaged parts to my car without my permission and without my knowledge. So I specifically said please stop working on it until I get the detailed estimate I was promised and had looked it over. The next day I decided to have my car towed to a different shop that specializes in Volkswagen and Audi cars. When I called Hesco to tell them what I had decided they informed me that my car was almost completely finished. The owner made a decision without my permission yet again and without calling to inform me what was going on. I was highly disappointed that every decision made about my car was made without my input or knowledge. And that my request for them to stop the repairs was completely ignored. This business is very unprofessional and lacks the ability to communicate with their customers. I also feel that I was taken advantage of because I am a woman. Not to mention the repairs done to my car were done wrong. I ended up having to have all the transmission fluid drained and replaced bc they used a brand that is not recommended for German cars. I also had to have the tires rebalanced and aligned bc Hesco didn't properly do that either. I do not recommend this business to anyone.

name: Douglas Smith
text: Apparently Jim Burke Subaru won't work on modified Subaru's (so basically every WRX)... Hesco came through and even purchased the updated software so that they could diagnose my car. Skip Jim Burke and take your modified Subie here.

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback Douglas, we are glad we were able to help when others fell short.

name: T Adams
text: These guys are truly great!

resp.text: Thank you, Rai for the 5-stars and kind words! We greatly appreciate it.

name: John Waldo
text: Don't take your Eaton supercharged vehicle here.

name: James C Gibson
text: Perfect service dept, on time with repairs, under quoted amount,  very pleased highly recommend,  they are a little short staffed in tech area, so big repairs take longer but every dealer is having this problem

name: Alex Lee
text: Understaffed for the services they advertise

name: Leigh Wright
text: Service department is professional, courteous and friendly

name: Jennifer Eastep (Texas Girl N Bama)
text: Very professional and friendly staff

name: Ken Klispie
text: Excellent service! The team at Guthrie's did a thorough inspection of our new/used minivan after it started making various intermittent sounds from a long cross country drive. They were able to pinpoint several issues that were small but would have left us stranded on our next big trip. Quick, very reasonable and communicative through the repairs. We did our next long trip without any issues or noises. We know where we will be taking all of our cars for service, thank you!

resp.text: Thank you, Ken for the review. We appreciate your business. We are happy to help with your automotive needs. Welcome to Alabama!!!

name: Steven Richardson
text: We were traveling through Alabama and my pickup broke down right off the 310 Cullom exit. The tow truck driver recommended Guthrie.  We were nervous not knowing anyone but were pleasantly surprised. We received text updates and a phone call to explain what needed to be done.  They exceeded our expectation completing the job quickly and at a fair price. Highly recommend their auto shop. God Bless.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Steven. We appreciate your kind words. We always try to get people back on the road. I know what it is like to be broken down on the road. Especially if you are on a schedule. Thank you so much for choosing Guthrie's Auto Service.

name: Michael Blair
text: Our car started experiencing some pretty severe issues on our drive home to Tennessee from Florida. We genuinely could not have chosen a better exit to pull over at! We pulled Guthrie's Auto up on our Maps and decided to take our car over there. Despite how busy they were, they were very understanding that we were from out of town and immediately got to work on our vehicle and offered recommendations on places to eat around since we had to wait several hours! Absolutely awesome service!

resp.text: We appreciate your words, and the 5 stars. We strive to give everyone a 5 star experience and help them along their way. Thanks again. Terry Guthrie

name: Victor Cornell
text: I've taken my cars there several times and always got good professional service which was reasonably priced.

resp.text: Thank you Victor, we appreciate your business. Terry

name: teresa cobbs
text: Great people. Keep you updated on progress and prices. Very trustworthy.

resp.text: Thank you Teresa, we appreciate your business and kind words. Terry

name: Barbara
text:
A Great Place/Great People... Our truck broke down & Triple A couldn’t have found a better place to take it to! They took us to our hotel & picked us back up....The owner went above & beyond to get our truck fixed so we could be back on the road this morning! Truck is running great again! Thank You So much for not only getting our truck fixed but for your kind & thoughtfulness.
Rick, Barbara & LACI

resp.text: It was a pleasure to meet you two. I was happy to help you all with your F-250 diesel. Glad you were able to get back on the road any get out of the flooding that we had that day. We were safe but got a lot of rain that day. Thanks again for letting us to serve you.

name: Janice McGahey
text: They got my car fixed in no time flat. The cost was super reasonable. And it’s been several weeks everything is running perfectly. I would highly recommend Terry and his crew!!

resp.text: Janice, thank you for your review! We're glad we could provide a quality auto repair service for you and we'll see you soon!

name: La Donna Griffin
text: I received very good service, both times I brought my car to Guthrie's.  Very nice employees., and patient with the questions I ask.  I'll be back.  I've recommended Guthrie's to a few people.

resp.text: Thank you La Donna for the 4 stars. We hoped to give you a 5 star experience when we serviced your Kia. Maybe next time. We do appreciate you trusting us with your vehicle. Terry Guthrie

name: Page Sparks
text: A couple years ago my car was really in a bad way, and took it to the dealership. They were going to charge me $1500 for my repair. I despaired and reached out to friends and family for recommendations. A good friend recommended Guthrie's, said they always did good work. So I called them up. For the same repair they were going to have to charge close to $900. It was better but still hurt. Took my car up and waited. Got a call from Mike and he said that he wanted to check over the car before I spent all that money. He discovered what the dealership didn't, that something was just unplugged. Only charged the diagnostic fee! He could have charged me fully, but he and this business have been ethical. I take my car to them anytime I have issues, and they've been precise and sure every time. Would highly recommend for anyone who's been burned by bad mechanics.

resp.text: Page, thank you for your review. We were happy to have been able to help you out with your vehicle and to save you money. We appreciate having you as a customer and we look forward to seeing you next time!

name: Hustle Hard Fitness
text: Very caring and reliable crew Terry and them have always took care of our car needs and always does a fantastic job! Great prices and they get it done it a timely manner

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review! We'll continue to provide a caring and reliable atmosphere for your auto repair needs and we look forward to helping you in the future!

name: Felicia Wright
text: Took my vehicle to have my AC looked at. They were very friendly and knowledgeable. Seemed to want to help me more than just make a dollar. They have a text system set up that notifies you when your vehicle is being worked on. The owner follows up with you a day or so after you pick up your vehicle to be sure everything is going well. Very personable business.

resp.text: Felicia, thank you for your review! We're happy to have looked at your A/C and we'll continue to be friendly and knowledgeable.

name: John Thomas
text: Broke down while traveling. They was very helpful and willing to get our truck repaired at very reasonable rates. I highly recommend Guthrie's Auto Service.

resp.text: John, thank you for your review, we hope you had safe traveling after visiting our auto repair shop, and please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you!

name: Bettie Burnett
text: Had car towed to Guthrie's for repair on coolant system. Had been told by two regular customers that they do really good work. The office attendant (Mike, I think was his name), was straight-forward, respectful, patient, gave me a phone quote, had the work done timely, with the final bill ending up being a little less than the original quote, even after adding the tow bill & taxes. It was a very welcomed change from the experience I'd had at another local shop I'd been referred to (but later warned about from several other past customers) where I repeatedly had to endure rudeness from the know-it-all mechanic, immediate breakdowns from same issue I'd just paid to have repaired, & ignored voicemails asking to speak to the owner. Guthrie's owner followed-up the very next day to make sure everything was going well with the work on my car. I would much rather pay for a job well done the first time than a little less and keep breaking down, having my car towed, finding another way to work at the last minute to keep my job, and then constantly being talked down to in person & over the phone (while the owner justifies it as him "being from New York",... to which I reminded them both that he's now n ALABAMA, & that cocky attitude won't do here, especially with me!!... 3 different types of repairs... never fixed after being told they were!). So, yes, I am very happy to give Guthrie's a positive review, THANK YOU!

resp.text: Bettie, thank you for your review. We were happy to help out with your coolant system repair and we are glad to be respectful, honest, and patient for all of our customers. We are sorry you had a bad experience at a different shop, but thank you for trusting us to get the job done. See you later!

name: Randy Anderson
text: Took my '08 Tundra in for some pretty major repairs (stuck secondary air intake valve, timing belt replacement, pulley repair). I’m beyond pleased with the quality of the work, the affordable price, and the speed of service you guys gave me. I’m new to the area, and will be coming back to you guys for any vehicle work that I need, and I’ll make sure to tell everyone else I meet about you as well! Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Randy! We're glad we could help you out with your '08 Tundra repairs, and we'll continue to offer quality and affordable auto repair services, and we are excited to have you as our customer. See you next time!

name: hotrodford 88
text: Great people to deal with.

name: Jeffrey Stevens
text: They were AAA approved brought truck in for water pump replacement they repaired it in a timely manner and did a over all inspection people were very friendly

resp.text: Jeffrey, thank you for your leaving us a review. We're glad to have helped you out and let us know if there anything we can do for you!

name: Cheryl Masterson
text: I was traveling thru Cullman car wouldn't start.  They repaired it same day. What a blessing, excellent service.

resp.text: Cheryl, we're so glad we could help you out while you were traveling through Cullman. Thank you for trusting us with your auto repair needs!

name: Mark Maddox
text: My truck needed help. I planned on it being in the shop for 7 to 10 days. I dropped it off on a Monday afternoon, and received a call on Friday afternoon that it was ready. Never did I think anyone could repair or replace as many things as Guthrie's did in such a short time. I left Guthrie's and drove to Gulf Shores. The true test, interstate highway's in Alabama. They did a great job. No vibration, shaking, or leaking. Awesome job guys. Thanks.

resp.text: Mark, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Here at Guthrie's Auto Service, we understand how important your vehicle is to you. That is why we always strive to provide quality care in a timely manner. It was a pleasure to work on your truck and we're thrilled to hear that your drive to Gulf Shores was smooth. We look forward to your next visit!

name: Jason Bookout
text: We were from out of town and our car broke down late on a Friday afternoon. Terry the owner fixed our busted coolant hose and had us back on the road in less than 2 hours for a fair price. He did not take advantage of a situation where we had no other choice.  I have later heard from other friends in the area that Terry does great work. Would highly recommend if you are in the area.

resp.text: Jason, we appreciate your kind review and were happy to assist with your coolant hose. We understand how frustrating it can be to deal with vehicle issues when you are out of town, so we were glad we could fix it quickly so you can be on your way. Thank you and please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you in the future!

name: tanya roberson
text: Very courteous, professional, high quality service! They solved our overheating issue and fixed it Fast! Highly recommend!! Best auto service in Cullman!!

resp.text: Tanya, thank you for your review! We're excited to continue to be courteous, professional, and provide high quality service! Looking forward to seeing you next time!

name: Xochitl Robinson

I thought this place was reasonable, but i cannot keep paying them bonuses to fix my car. I ask them to do an oil change this last time and they did not do it. Done with Dave, Jason and the whole bunch, just done.I DO NOT RECOMMEND ANDERSON'S AUTOMOTIVE FOR CAR REPAIRS. Something is wrong, they should stand behind their work!  Reporting them to BBB! Done they arent fixing the problem. I will not use them again! Pretty angry with them., they don't stabd behind their work, they say it was thus this time, disappointed just disappointed. I have nothing but good regards for each and every person working there that day. I can't complement them enough. Definitely deserved a sixth star that day. text: So I post many reviews and honestly I hate for them to be negative but I have had a horrible experience here. I went in on Tuesday 12/18 because my car was running hot. Tammy was nice enough to give me a ride home while I waited. Firstly my car was not correctly diagnosed I spent over 500$ here and still having the same issue. When I picked it up drove toward Wal-Mart it immediately got hot so the looked at it again right before closing then i leave again same thing finally I park in publix to let it cool down. Again in the morning I take it back. Again they check it send me on my way 30 minutes later car hot again. I call and was pretty much brushed off and was told that they fixed what they thought was the problem. So as of right now I've been charged all this money car still running hot n they acting like it's cool I came in with 1 problem which has still not to be resolved. I will I'm so disappointed I travel alot for work and I'm in Alabama all alone no family I came here expecting a1 service seeing that it's connected to a napa but to spend this type of money and my issue not be fixed I'm so disappointed. Now I have to go get my car worked on all over again so I can hopefully make it home for Christmas.

name: Wj Brown
text:
My daughter’s 07 Kia Sorento stopped on her on the freeway in Atlanta, she had it towed to a shop in Atlanta. They replaced the battery and alternator 500.00.  Two weeks later she is getting warning lights on the dashboard. Fearing that it might be more problems, when she came home for a wedding, I called Greystone Auto and took it in for a diagnostic. In less then 30 mins, results were in; defective alternator(new) . The folks at Greystone called the Atlanta shop and coordinated an under warranty replacement. That was a blessing not to have to worry about my daughter having a malfunctioning car while living there alone.
I have always gotten good service and fair prices here. I have had at least 5 repairs done there and never a complaint.
Thanks Brooke and all the folks there for easing our anxieties.! Now I have another review to write about that Atlanta shop 😡!

text:
Women: do not go there! Send a man!  I had trouble getting someone at the desk. I need a new light for my brakes (just one). They wanted $40.00 and I have the bulb !  No respect !!
As a woman I am used to being taken advantage of!!!!!!’

resp.text: Hello, Karen. Unfortunately we were slammed this morning so we apologize if we were not able to get to you sooner at the counter. We were not able to install this for you because you bought the part through Autozone and for legal reasons we must install our own parts in the shop. We would never discriminate or take advantage of anyone based on their gender, the reason we could not help you is simply because the part was not purchased through us. If you'd like to discuss this further, feel free to call us at the shop. Thank you.

I’m completely frustrated and have received warnings for no tag, so I now have a vehicle I can’t drive because I’m way beyond my 10 business days to have a tag. I recommend you shop somewhere else. When I tried to go get it now they are saying it needs a whole new motor. It was so many levels to this, but I would never in my life ever buy a Dodge and I will never go to that dealership again. Everyone that work there is a complete joke.

name: Christopher Peters
text: They have trouble wearing masks correctly. Also, the Service department treats customers like an after thought.

name: jan vickers
text: automation is awesome! they bought my vehicle and found the exact suv I wanted!! Alexis was so sweet, and oh so helpful!

name: Jackie Camp
text: When my 2014 Chrysler 200 needs service I take it to AutoNation because they are professional and they check everything to make sure no issues arise.  When it's going to be a long wait they come and let you know were they are on each step of repair.  They always have coffee and water if needed.  They also check on recall parts so you want have to come back they fix it doing your service visit.  They always offer other discounts on oil changes, tires and other necessities.  I wouldn't take my Chrysler anywhere else.

name: Matt Montenegro
text: Some of the most sleezy people that give all car sales men a bad name. Purchased a used vehicle from this dealership in May of 2020. I was sold when I was told that my vehicle had an Auto Nation warranty of "90 days or 4,000 miles." Sounds great doesn't it? Well after being hurried along in signing paperwork so the vehicle could be mine I was very happy with my purchase. However, less than a month later, and still well within my "warranty" coverage period I got a Christmas tree of lights on my dashboard. I was told to take it to its dealership and from there I could then make the claim. When I called to make the claim, Auto Nation's warranty service said there was no vehicle with my VIN in the system. I then called the manager there who told me, "I never signed any contract stating I had a warranty and it doesn't matter what I was told because it isn't in writing." I realized the manager was right about this however, I was being told one thing then they intentionally rushed me through signing paperwork so that I wouldn't catch that I never signed anything for my "warranty". The deceptive methods of these people shows that they are talented at one thing and, one thing only and, that is lying to people. These people are clearly slimy and cannot be trusted, save yourself the hassle and do not purchase a vehicle from here. Learn from my mistake, don't come here. Where ever you do go, whatever you are offered make sure it is in writing!!!!

name: William Mott
text: The two service advisors I usually deal with are Michael Robinson and Ken Baker; they are always friendly and helpful. I dropped off my truck for service (oil change, tire rotation, etc.) and Ken Baker called back to notify me that my vehicle was ready. As far I know, the work was done satisfactorily.

name: Charles Bailey
text: I’ve never had any problems with them. Good quality work on time. They’ll tell you if something else needs to be looked at.

name: Samantha Stefan
text: I have purchased 3 Vehicles from this Dealership with my Husband and have had the same salesman Austyn ! He is Humble and Honest and that means a lot these days when purchasing a vehicle. They met my expectations and we will continue to buy from here as long as he is there. The best experiences I have ever had at any Dealership and I have bought many vehicles in my lifetime!!! Thank you Austyn you Rock !!!

name: Alfonso Packer
text: Consumer service was very poor. Upon arrival to pick up my car after recall work I had to stand in the lobby for 20mins before I was even acknowledged to get help. Then the service guy who said he had my paper so he would him me continued a phone call for an additional 30 mins. It didn’t bother me until I heard the conversation, which seemed personal not AutoNation business related, so I decided to go to parts while I waited to get so things. That department was great. After finishing up he still was on phone so I went to someone else to see if I could be helped then he decided to pull up my paperwork and noticed it was a recall job and only need a signature and to hand me my keys. I will never probably use the service department if that was a example of the customer service to expect.

name: Richard Dodson
text: Had some warranty work done on my 2019 Ram 1500. Troy was very knowledgeable of what needed to be done, and the service technicians did a great with the small issues that had, andchad my truck ready to go in a timely manner. Great job Autonation team.

name: Ms. Kay
text: Great service team. Ken was extremely patient throughout the journey. I experienced some flood damage in September 2019 that required major repairs to include a rental for a few weeks. Updates were offered and a complete thorough summary of what was serviced. Ken and the team wereprofessional. My vehicle was as showroom ready as the day I purchased it from them. Roll Tide.

name: Daijha Doss
text: NONE of my experiences at autonation have been pleasant. I’m either here all day or have to leave my car for days at a time because they can’t seem to do their jobs. My car was there for 2 days just to get the battery changed (I kid you not). Now I’m waiting on a part for my car and dear lord you would think they had to actually build the part themselves. I’ve been told 3 different stories about this part. I’ve had my car for almost 4 years now and EVERY SINGLE TIME I’m in there someone is upset about how they run this place. Now I’m that someone. Thanks for nothing Autonation. Keep up the good work.

name: Rick McNeill

Was given a call 20 min before closing time and said that my ride was ready, got there 40 min later due to traffic and they said they closed. So honestly never doing business with this dealership ever again. I suggest everyone get oil changes at Honda rather than this dealership... buy your cars somewhere else, the bad service outweighs the quality of their trucks.

text: I was completely satisfied with the Service Advisor, Mike Robinson’s eagerness and prompt service to my problem. I definitely enjoyed the awesome service. I will recommend him to friends and colleagues. Also, Autonation as somewhere to go for all their car related needs.

Great company, great atmosphere, and it was awesome working with Chris and Austin

Thanks guys

name: Dana Adcock
text: 10 years ago we bought a new Jeep Grand Cherokee.   No one has ever touched this car but Auto Nation.  A couple months age my husband took the car in for repair.  A new condenser had to be installed.  After the work was completed, when we picked the car up, the dash lights were out.   We were told there would be an additional $300 or more to fix it.  This was very shabby business as it was fine before the work was done.   I’ve had a couple of issues with this establishment but let it go but this is going to far to expect us to pay for something that was broken while a very expensive repair was being done on the car.

name: Daniel Eisrnhard
text: Sid was very helpful throughout the whole process of repairing my wife’s vehicle through the extended warranty.  He spent time on the phone dealing with my warranty company and when it came time he even drove me in his own vehicle to the rental company.

name: Diane Krause
text: I took my car in for repair of the power adjustment on the driver seat. The service rep who took care of me made the scheduling and check-in nice and easy and arranged for the shuttle service to take me home. I was disappointed that the AutoNation website didn't allow me to schedule an appointment for repairs online (only maintenance services could be done online). I got a diagnosis and repair quote within a day, but word that it would take a week to get the part in. It turned out to be an additional day for the part to arrive, and I was told the car would be done the following day, but  it took two more days for it to get done. We came from the Houston area where we were used to parts being accessible more quickly, so this wait time may be normal for the Mobile area. The pickup experience was a bit frustrating. I picked up on a Saturday and waited 1 hour 15 minutes to get checked out (was told the car was ready but paperwork had to be done). The service rep kept getting pulled away by walk-ins, phone calls, and I'm not sure what else, but it seemed I kept getting bumped to the back of the line. There may have been more legitimate reasons for the long wait time, but those weren't shared with me. Everyone was nice and helpful, and my car was repaired, but the wait times were a bit disappointing.

text: Parts department is a joke. Spent 10 minutes going in circles trying to reach someone there. Eventually just hangup.

It’s weird to me that I didn’t get the title that day but now it has been a month and I still don’t have the paperwork. I’m still driving around with no tag, just the temp tag.

I would say from the time I drove in to the time I left with a check was less than an hour and they gave me 50% more than what Carmax offered.  Karen in the online department was great to sit with while the service guys did a quick inspection and prepared the paperwork and check.  If you're looking to sell a vehicle and don't want to mess with CL or haggle with another dealer, autonation was great for me.

name: Roy Hunt
text:
Everyone very hush hush, talking  why looking somewhere else, very pessimistic, Doomsday attitude. I know it's all to protect them from liability suits. What ever happened to trust, recommendations, honest opinions? Every answer to every question seemed will rehearsed. Two days later my alternator goes out! Maybe a coincidence, but it seems like everyone I put my trust in the professionals, things start going wrong with my car. Don't trust mechanics, lawyers, maintenance individuals, had one of them tell me, "if we fix it too well, we'll be out of a job, always have to leave something for another day." There's no real honest people in this area, not anymore. Bureaucrats have got their fingers into everything. Law suits are the "American Way!" So you can't really blame them to avoid taking responsibility for their actions. I know what my part costs, they were going to charge me nearly $500 in labor to loosen and tighten bout 6 bolts? A little extreme, they did an estimate but I never got to see it, I asked to see the defective part, but was given the excuse we would have to put it back on the lift. Since it wasn't on the lift, they had no plans to fix it!

Allen from Phenix Firestone called, his only concern was why I was so critical of him. I thought that was clear, but this was the second time I took this vehicle there for the same issue, the first time I was told nothing was wrong with it. In any case in order to resolve the problem Allen stated, "we're not working in your cars anymore!" I guess I hurt his feelings?

I used to love taking a vehicle to Phenix Firestone, always felt like they were looking out for me, always trusted them! Now I get the feeling I'm unimportant, it's really changed over the years!

Enough said hope you all have a great holiday I'll be home fixing my cars! LoL!

resp.text: Roy, thank you for taking the time to leave a thorough review! We welcome all feedback as hearing from our customers is the best way we can improve our business. We apologize for any inconvenience. Take care.

name: Julie Hughes
text:
I had an appointment for an oil change at 10:00 am. I was told that it would be ready in a couple of hours.  I left my car for 4 hours. When I arrived at 2 pm, Kyle didn’t know about my car. When he finally found the paperwork, he said,”they can put it on the rack now.”  I informed him that I had to be home by 3 pm and I live an hour away and to please just bring me my keys. He brought my keys, rudely handed them to me and said,”Bye.”
I was not rude to him. I did tell him that this happened before and that I just needed my keys.
I am more disappointed in the way he handled this. He never once apologized and seemed annoyed that I couldn’t wait.  I think 4 hours is plenty of time for a 15 min. oil change.
Customer service goes a long way!

name: Dorothy Carter
text: I was in the service  department  yesterday  I had another  service   associate. I hate too give a  bad review because  I have been  dealing  with  Nissan  since  2014 this associate  name is ADAM. MONTGOMERY he doesn't have good customer  service  skills. I watch  the other  associate  come in and out and communicate  with customers.He never communicate  beyond checkin.This was first  time the lady a the desk call too sign out for my car.I had go back in tooask for the oil sticker that goes in the window. He did enforce. me my car was ready. Maybe he was upset because  I told him I didn't  need a tire rotation  because I DID one the last visit .I just purchase  this car in August  last year. Next time I will get someone else in the service  department  not him. I Jim Burke  Nissan Sales and Service But Adam Montgomery  is not a good  associate .

name: Beth Jeszka
text:
If I could give negative stars I would. I dropped my 2005 Nissan Titian off to have some recall work completed, diagnostics ran, O2 sensors replaced and an oil change. I used one of their rental cars, as the truck would not be finished for several days. I left my truck, after giving them a budget of $1500.00, got on to the interstate and went about my day. I woke up in the morning and the car was not there. I talked it over with my roommate and we agreed i should call the police. Long story short, I tried calling Nissan to let them know the situation. I left several messages, tried calling my appointed service tech, sent an email and even had a conversation with the online chat. This happened Wednesday night- Thursday. I finally received a response, via email, stating my truck was finished. Total cost was just over $300.00. The recall work was covered, the cost was for the rental. All of the work I requested to have completed was not finished. The invoice didn't even reflect my request, the issues my truck is having or why I brought to them. In true honesty, they did complete the recall issues.
I will be staying with Benton Nissan or my personal mechanic, lesson learned.

name: Kayti ackerman
text: Awesome people and service...period...my oil changes are free and I didn't even buy my Nissan from them...also they provide a decent military discount...did it without me even knowing or having to ask once they saw my tag. Wait times can be a little long so watch your timing.

text: Great love the service Had a lil wait time  but its cool...

name: Pamela Williams
text: This is by far the BEST Nissan service department I have ever had experience with. We own 3 Nissans our teenage/college kids drive and have about 25 Nissans in our company fleet. Needless to say we have a lot of experience with dealerships and I have not come across one that compares to the superior service Jim Burke Nissan provides! Ron was absolutely amazing helping our two sons who broke down just outside of Birmingham while driving back to Florida from Mississippi. If you want your vehicle worked on by a company that is honest and goes above and beyond this is the service department to go to! Thank you Ron and Jim Burke Nissan! What a top-notch company!

text: I made an appointment a week in advance, came to my appointment only to be told there would be a 2 hour wait. I left very disappointed. What's the purpose of the appointment if YOU can't keep it. A total waste of my time.

text:

name: Steve Zanussi
text:
After noticing at a road stop that there was a bubble on the sidewall of my tire while on a long trip, I went to the closest Tire Discounters I could find.  There I was told that it would be at least three hours to change my tire.  They referred me to this location--8873 Highway 72, Huntsville--several miles away.

Upon entering I was greeted by the General Manager, Tyler Thurmond, who assessed the tire, and notified me that they did not have my tire in stock.  (They did have it in stock at the first place, but they had never checked.)  Tyler told me that it would take an hour and a half to get the tire there, but that once they had it, it could be put on very quickly.

Tyler had the delivery of the tire expedited for us, because we mentioned that we had to get up north by a set time.  The entire visit took about 45 minutes, including the delivery of the tire.

Thank you so much, Tyler Thurmond, for your exceptional customer service.  If I find myself needing a tire in Huntsville again, I know where I will go.

resp.text: Wowzeritos! Thanks for the review, Steve. We really appreciate the 5 stars and hope to see ya again for any of your tire or auto care needs! Take a look at our full services at https://tirediscounters.com/services

name: Andrew Smith
text: BUYER BEWARE!  I would recommend to do research on any pricing they give you.  Here is what happened.  Called got a verbal quote of $139-189 per axle for a brake job with rotor's turned which is fair they are just below the dealer which was $200 per axle.  Went the next day to have services done to my car.  Before they began work they inspected it and determine I needed pads all the way and rotor's on the rear and a brake fluid exchange.  Estimate price was over $700.  I declined the brake fluid exchange and they offered some "competitive" discounts brought my total down to about $580.  Still more than it should be.  Asked for a printed estimate when I saw the estimate I knew something was up.  They had part numbers and prices on the estimate.  Quick Google search confirmed the part numbers and prices from a local part supply store that they would be getting the parts from.  They are marking up parts pricing 100+%.  Industry standard is between 10-25%.  Then they told me that the estimate was nearly at cost and if he went any lower he would lose his job.  Nothing but scam and scare tactics were used with me and I didn't take the bait.  Tried to email the address on the general managers card it wouldn't ever go through.  Called the corporate office gave them the info and the pictures I have attached here and they said a regional manager would get back with me still have not heard from that person either.  BEWARE OF THIS PLACE AND THE CHECK ANY PRICES THEY GIVE YOU!

resp.text: We take pride in our craft and place a great amount of emphasis on pricing ourselves competitively. We are continuously evaluating. We want to dig in to learn more. If you are willing, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon.

Jody and Sarah got my car  straight in to the garage and my tire being fixed.  The customer service that the two of them and there staff showed today helped turn a bad day into a BLESSED DAY. My daughter and I sat for a little bit and before I knew it the tire was repaired. Thanks  guys for helping us out ! We will definitely come back to see you in the future !

resp.text: Thank you so much for the FIVE STAR Review! Have a fantastic day!

name: shadow
text: Cody Smith was amazing! He worked until he found the right car and deal for us. He made sure we left happy and 100% satisfied. Will recommend him and this dealership to anyone I know. Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you Amber for the WONDERFUL REVIEW!

name: Cody Smith
text: Easy going. Laid back. Darla and Jason are the best!

resp.text: Thank you Cody for the GREAT Review!

name: David Sneed
text: Picked up a new Titan XD and could not be happier. Fabulous salespeople and excellent management working with the customers.  The selection of Nissan and Toyota vehicles basically at one location is outstanding.

resp.text: Thank you David for the Wonderful Review! Congratulations on your Titan XD Purchase!!

name: Janice Cleckler
text: Very nice salesman and staff that we encountered .we love our new car.

resp.text: Thank you Janice for the Five Star Review!

name: Ron Rothenstine
text: Had my 2008 Titan serviced ,they left the air breather cover off and didn't put a new air filter in, my add washer fluid warning light came on, they did not rotate my tires, I can only hope they changed my oil and filter

resp.text: Hello Ron. We are so sorry to hear about this visit. We'd love the opportunity to make it right.

name: John Ogden
text: Salesman acted like he didn''t know us

resp.text: Hello John. We are sorry to hear about this. Unfortunately sometimes we do not remember every customer. If you have any further concerns please call our Owner Loyalty Manager at 205-312-0830.
